body: Approach sounds reasonable. Just the one comment
There's an error running this fix on PHP 7.0 cli. Looking into it

This is quite strange - on PHP7, if I run the unit tests on cli (from `src/php`, run `/usr/bin/php -d extension=grpc.so /usr/bin/phpunit -v --debug ./tests/unit_tests`), it will segfault perhaps 3 out of 4 times, and it's flaky. This does not happen with PHP5 at all.

```
Starting test 'TimevalTest::testSimilarInvalidParam'.
.                                   96 / 96 (100%)

Time: 681 ms, Memory: 4.00Mb

OK (96 tests, 233 assertions)
*** Error in `/usr/bin/php': corrupted double-linked list: 0x00005563ae616870 ***
======= Backtrace: =========
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x777e5)[0x7f8919db07e5]

/usr/bin/php(_start+0x29)[0x5563adc133b9]

7f8908000000-7f8908021000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0

...
7f891b719000-7f891b71a000 r--p 00017000 08:01 2061                       /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libresolv-2.23.so
7f891b71a000-7f891b71b000 rw-p 00018000 08:01 2061                       /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libresolv-2.23.so

7f891b92c000-7f891b936000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
```

I managed to fix the flakes - I need to do the class entry initializations in the MINIT function.

So things seem stable now
